title: Being a Farm and Ranch REALTOR: Dr. Charles Porter

tasks.task: Understanding the complexities of farming and ranching as a real estate business.
subtasks: Walking the land to understand its three-dimensional aspects.
Considering mineral rights, water rights, leases, and crop leases when evaluating properties.
Recognizing the changing dynamics of the farming and ranching industry since 2007.
Explaining the tax advantages of agricultural valuation for landowners.
Discussing fiduciary duties as a real estate broker when handling farm and ranch properties.

tasks.task: Promoting further education and resources for understanding farm and ranch practices.
subtasks: Offering a four-hour farm and ranch class for more in-depth knowledge.
Providing a seven-hour credit class for extensive learning.
Recommending Dr. Charles Gilliland's book on buying Texas land.
